intro: Hypolytrum parvibracteum var. quadriglumatum, commonly known as the four-bracted hypolytrum, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family, commonly referred to as the sedge family. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, clustered inflorescences. Its leaves are typically narrow and grass-like, and it produces tiny, three-lobed flowers arranged in dense clusters. This species is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and swampy areas.
